Create a mirrored volume with all acceptable fs types and qos

Delete a volume

Test Description: Create a three way mirrored volume, delete plexes till volume remains with a single plex.
Increase the size of volume and save it.
Create a volume with invalid name
Verify whether the details of volume like name, size, status, file system are displayed correctly on volume list page
Search a volume by name, locality, fstype, node, status on the list page
Edit the column view on volume list page. The columns added / deleted should reflect on list page
The status of volume like Available, Attached. Assigned, Deleting, PendingDelete, etc should be displayed correctly
Expected Behaviour: Could not check for status Assigned, Deleting, PendingDelete.

Test Description: Sort the volume list by various parameters
Verify whether information displayed on volume detail page is correct, like name, mirror count, state, condition, etc
Do above test with mirrored volume. check information when volume is in available state and  also when volume is in attached state.

Create a mirrored volume detach a plex. In UI on volume details page plex should be in detached state. Do IOs on volume. Attach plex. In UI plex should go into resyncing state. After successful resync plex should go into InUse state. Detach volume. Plexes should move into InSync state.
Click on Export button and see whether all details are exported correctly
Sort the volumes by name / size or rearrrange the column names and then click on export
Expected Behaviour: The exported file should retain the format of sorting or column names

Create PV using ISCSI
